My take on the conflict of freedom & crime:
There is little. Why? Take extremist info as an example, we're currently looking at either let them talk (in freedom) or ban their posts (suspected to be taking away freedom of speech). If we only see those options one will always hurt a portion of people. 
How to get around? Well, I'm thinking of a "hiding rule subscription" solution. Basically, one can subscribe or customize their own set of rules to block certain kind of info that they don't want to see. While "extremists" can still publish their content, people don't see them if they choose not to. Plain and simple.
"But as long as the content is out there, people still have a chance to see them, and get 'brainwashed' " That case would be one in a million. Because people that are not interested in such content will block them in the first place (and I can even support such rules being enabled by default, as long as there's an option to turn then off), and people who do see those content (constantly, in order to be 'brainwashed') are the ones that do believe in such mindset in the first place.
Seeing this from the other perspective, if we enforce blocking of such content, it's the same to the people that have the option to do so on their own under the "subscription solution", and to the "dark side" you're just making it harder but they'll figure out a way to get around. You'll never know when you'll find out a telegram station up and running in the middle of nowhere ;-) Plus you're giving them one more reason to hate, as seen from their perspective that we're taking away their freedom of speech & belief, and that they must have their own kingdom to live their desired life. The harder you press, the harder they hit back.
Let's summerize:
[Subscription solution of choice: ]
Most people happy, extremists happy, but thin risk of extremist info hitting "regular" people;
[Enforcement solution: ]
Most people happy, extremists mad, still thin risk of extremists' voice being heard, more reason to hate, higher risk of social instability (terror attacks etc)
-END-
Debates welcomed, ZeroMail welcomed.
